abstract: News on Thursday that the Fed would raise the interest rate that it charges banks for temporary loans was seen by lenders as a sign that their long, profitable period of ultralow rates was coming to an end, The New York Times reports.
snippet: News on Thursday that the Fed would raise the interest rate that it charges banks for temporary loans was seen by lenders as a sign that their long, profitable period of ultralow rates was coming to an end, The New York Times reports.
lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve to Wall Street: The days of easy money — and, just maybe, easy profits — are numbered, Graham Bowley and Eric Dash report in The New York Times.

headline.main: Fed Move May Signal End to Easy Bank Profits

abstract: Former Bank of America chief Kenneth D. Lewis said he was briefed twice on his company’s decision not to disclose rising losses at Merrill Lynch, before the bank’s takeover of Merrill was put before shareholders, Reuters reported.
snippet: Former Bank of America chief Kenneth D. Lewis said he was briefed twice on his company’s decision not to disclose rising losses at Merrill Lynch, before the bank’s takeover of Merrill was put before shareholders, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the former Bank of America chief executive, said he was briefed twice on his company’s decision not to disclose rising losses at Merrill Lynch before the bank’s takeover of Merrill was put before shareholders, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Lewis Was Briefed Twice on Merrill Disclosure

abstract: Bank of America and UBS, which eliminated jobs over the past two years as they received government aid, are luring bankers in London from competitors by as much as doubling base salaries, recruiters told Bloomberg News.
snippet: Bank of America and UBS, which eliminated jobs over the past two years as they received government aid, are luring bankers in London from competitors by as much as doubling base salaries, recruiters told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: It’s shaping up to be another seller’s market for British financiers, and even bailed-out banks are coming out of a season of cutbacks to beef up their teams again.

headline.main: Cuts Behind Them, Salaries Said to Rise in London
